title: Hill Top to Moss Eccles Tarn Walking Route

images.title: Ian Taylor / Moss Eccles Tarn
images.caption: A beautiful snowy scene at Moss Eccles tarn during December 2008. Beyond the frozen tarn Brim Fell can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Christine Hasman / Moss Eccles Tarn
images.caption: Moss Eccles Tarn. According to a National Trust guide at Hill Top, Beatrix Potter's home in Near Sawrey, this peaceful tarn was one of the author's favourite fishing spots.

images.title: Rob Farrow / Hill Top - with visitors
images.caption: Hill Top. Visitors linger in front of Beatrix Potter's home at Hill Top, Near Sawrey (it's called "Near", that's not simply a preposition). Entry is by timed ticket to this National Trust property as its size is such that only a few people can wander around it at any one time.

images.title: Peter Trimming / Garden at Hill Top, Near Sawrey
images.caption: Garden at Hill Top

images.title: Peter Trimming / Near Sawrey, Cumbria
images.caption: Near Sawrey, Cumbria. Some of the houses in this small village. The Tower Bank Arms is just out of picture, to the left.

description: Hill Top is the 17th century former home of children's author and illustrator Beatrix Potter. It is located in Near Sawrey in the Lake District National park and open to the public.  You can tour the house and gardens where expert guides will tell you all about the life and works of Beatrix Potter. This nice short walk is ideal for visitors to Hill Top to try after or before their visit. It takes you up to the lovely Moss Eccles Tarn  - Beatrix Potter owned the tarn and donated it to the National Trust after her death. It served as an inspiration for some of her stories.  Alfred Wainwright described it as the 'most attractive tarn on Claife Heights'. It's stocked with water lilies and fish, and surrounded by pretty rhododendrons. A pleasant walking trail leads up to the tarn and you can return the same way or through other woodland tracks.
